meanings.definition: Resembling a bird in form or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The toy airplane had an ornithoid shape with wings and a beak.
meanings.sent2: The colorful feathers on the costume gave it an ornithoid look.
meanings.sent3: The ornithoid hat made him look like a giant bird ready to take flight.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements on stage were ornithoid, as if she could soar at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted an ornithoid landscape with birds flying high in the sky.

meanings.definition: Having the appearance or qualities of a bird.
meanings.sent1: The new drone had an ornithoid design, mimicking the flight patterns of birds.
meanings.sent2: The ornithoid features of the sculpture made it a favorite among bird enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The ornithoid mask made him feel like a bird whisperer, attracting feathered friends.
meanings.sent4: Her ornithoid voice soared through the auditorium, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The ornithoid wings of the plane flapped gracefully as it took off into the sky.
